column4: Hello, how can i apply a .diff patch to sourcecode from within ubuntu itself?
do you have the source code already, and do you know how to build it?
i have the source and know how to build it (which is not possible on ubuntu)
well, it's quite possible that the version of the sources you're patching isn't the same version the patch is against
its a windows app that only compiles with msvc
ok i have modified the patch so it matches the revision im using, but it still gives me the same error, activiting -p doesnt fix it
it's definitely not happy ... at all.
I've reproduced your problem, will look deeper now
definitely looks like a line ending issue: your sources are CRLF endings, and the patch file is in Unix format
there might be an option on patch, otherwise you can convert all your sources by running dos2unix on them
if I run `find -type f -exec dos2unix {} \;` the patch then applies (except for one failed hunk), but that's a bit drastic
that's the best I can come up with.  Works for me
i found the problem, the zip file was using windows line endings, if i do a svn checkout everything should apply correctly
that's good, is what I thought
